body:
Hmmm, what's the backtrace on that?

If the change you made works, then :+1:, but I don't understand why, so I'm curious what the underlying problem is...
I'll post the stack trace in a minute, but the cause is it trying to build a collection decorator for a class that didn't have a decorator to use.

Here's the stack trace:


Ah ok. Your solution makes sense then.

Another option would be to short-circuit the whole process with something more like this:

``` diff
diff --git a/lib/active_admin/resource_controller/decorators.rb b/lib/active_admin/resource_controller/decorators.rb
index eff324a..4bd99f5 100644
--- a/lib/active_admin/resource_controller/decorators.rb
+++ b/lib/active_admin/resource_controller/decorators.rb
@@ -22,9 +22,11 @@ module ActiveAdmin
       end

       def collection_decorator
-        collection_decorator = collection_decorator_class_for(decorator_class)
+        if decorator_class.present?
+          collection_decorator = collection_decorator_class_for(decorator_class)

-        delegate_collection_methods_for_draper(collection_decorator, decorator_class)
+          delegate_collection_methods_for_draper(collection_decorator, decorator_class)
+        end
       end

       # Draper::CollectionDecorator was introduced in 1.0.0

```

Either way seems fine to me.

Would you like me to drum up a pull-request? Or do you got this one.
I got it -- just wanted to make sure the reason for the bug made sense to you.
Yep, now that you've explained the issue and I've looked through the code, it makes plenty of sense. Thanks for catching this and handling it. :beers:
